    validate

    validate.Rmd

    Purpose: to validate the input datasets before performing aggregation

    The primary function for validation is validate_data(). This function is called automatically when you run aggregate_data(), so it is not necessary to perform validation manually. However, you can manually validate the data if you wish.

    The function will return a character vector, with entries describing any issues found in the input data. If there are no issues, the vector will be empty. If there are any issues, aggregation will not be possible until those issues have been resolved.

    library(rapidcycler)
    # Assuming patient_data, vaccination_data, and outcome_data are data.table objects already loaded into the global environment
validate_input_data(patient_data, vaccination_data, outcome_data,
                    cycle_start_date = as.Date("2022-01-01"),
                    cycle_end_date = as.Date("2022-01-31"),
                    options_file_location = here::here(),
                    split_size = 500000)

# NOTE: set vaccination_data = NULL to validate historical data

    Developed by Benjamin Atkins.
